intro: Ouratea spiciformis, commonly known as the spicate ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered white flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
